title: Skip Blumberg
text:
Skip Blumberg (born October 10, 1947) is one of the original camcorder-for-broadcast TV producers, and among the first wave of video artists in the 1970s. His early work reflects the era's emphasis on guerrilla tactics and medium-specific graphics, but his more recent work takes on more global issues. His work has screened widely on television and at museums. His video Pick Up Your Feet: The Double Dutch Show (1981) is considered a classic documentary video and was included in the Museum of Television and Radio's exhibition TV Critics' All-time Favorite Shows. His cultural documentaries and performance videos have been broadcast on <a href="PBS">PBS</a>, National Geographic TV, Showtime, Bravo, <a href="Nickelodeon%20%28TV%20channel%29">Nickelodeon</a>, among others.
He was a part of the early video collective <a href="Videofreex">Videofreex</a>.
He is currently producing works for <a href="The%20My%20Hero%20Project">The My Hero Project</a>. and <a href="Sesame%20Street">Sesame Street</a> along with various independent productions.
